title: Football news: Graham Potter wants Aaron Connolly to keep feet on the ground
text:
Graham Potter had not heard of Aaron Connolly when he arrived as Brighton manager in the summer.

Not many had, judging by the fact that not a single person picked the young forward in the Premier League’s Fantasy Football game at the start of the season.

Yet the 19-year-old from Galway, who used to spend his afternoons at home watching Premier League Years on TV, introduced himself properly on Saturday.

Brighton's 19-year-old forward Aaron Connolly scored twice against Spurs on Saturday

Graham Potter seemed reluctant to praise Connolly too highly in his post-match interviews

Connolly’s second goal against Tottenham was remarkably similar to Serge Gnabry’s first in Bayern Munich’s 7-2 Champions League win over Spurs.

Potter seemed reluctant to praise Connolly too highly in his post-match interviews, perhaps in a bid to keep the young man’s feet on the ground, but this was a special performance.

‘You have to remember he is only 19, so there will be times when he acts mature and there will be times where he is his age,’ said Potter. ‘That is normal. But he is a good lad.

‘From day one he has shown his quality. He wants to run in behind and he wants to threaten the goal. Those are two good qualities to have.’
description: Graham Potter had not heard of Aaron Connolly when he arrived as Brighton manager in the summer. Not many had - not a single person picked him for Fantasy Football at the start of the season.
authors: Kieran Gill For The Daily Mail
